item.title: 普洛斯以创纪录的两位数票息出售美元债券
item.description: 普洛斯私人有限公司在一份声明中表示，由于需求不足以达到定价目标，该公司将不再发行美元债券。【原文：GLP Pte will not proceed with its dollar bond issuance as demand is not sufficient to reach its pricing goal, the logistics real estate developer said in a statement.】

item.title: 立邦涂料达成 23 亿美元交易，股价创 24 年来最大涨幅
item.description: 立邦涂料控股公司（Nippon Paint Holdings Co.【原文：Shares of Nippon Paint Holdings Co. surged following its announcement of a deal to acquire a US-based chemicals formulator.】

item.title: 关注美国关键数据和大选结局，黄金走势平稳
item.description: 黄金小幅下跌，原因是交易商正在准备重要的经济数据，这些数据将有助于为美联储下一步的政策决定奠定基础，同时美国总统大选继续进入倒计时。【原文：Gold held a modest decline as traders prepared for key economic data that will help to set the stage for the next Federal Reserve policy decision, while the countdown to the US presidential election continued.】

item.title: 布雷特-泰勒的人工智能初创公司 Sierra 估值 45 亿美元
item.description: 由 OpenAI 主席布雷特-泰勒（Bret Taylor）和 Alphabet 公司前高管克莱-巴弗（Clay Bavor）创立的人工智能初创公司 Sierra Technologies Inc.【原文：Sierra Technologies Inc., the artificial intelligence startup founded by OpenAI Chairman Bret Taylor and former Alphabet Inc. executive Clay Bavor, has raised $175 million in a financing round that values the company at $4.5 billion.】

item.title: 贝索斯称《邮报》拒绝为其背书是为了消除 "信誉差距
item.description: 亚马逊公司创始人、《华盛顿邮报》的所有者杰夫-贝索斯（Jeff Bezos）表示，该报停止为总统候选人背书的决定解决了困扰媒体行业的 "信誉差距 "问题。【原文：Amazon.com Inc. founder Jeff Bezos, the owner of the Washington Post, said the newspaper’s decision to stop endorsing presidential candidates addresses a “credibility gap” afflicting the media industry.】

item.title: 大选临近，比特币自 6 月以来首次突破 70,000 美元
item.description: 受专用交易所交易基金资金流入以及对下周美国大选潜在结果的猜测推动，比特币自6月以来首次突破70,000美元。【原文：Bitcoin rose past $70,000 for the first time since June, bolstered by inflows into dedicated exchange-traded funds as well as speculation about potential outcomes from next week’s US election.】

item.title: 石油下跌 6% 后趋于平稳，关注中东风险和美国数据
item.description: 由于市场关注中东局势的发展和即将公布的美国经济数据，石油价格在周一暴跌 6% 后企稳。【原文：Oil steadied after tumbling 6% on Monday, as the market focused on developments in the Middle East and upcoming US economic data.】

item.title: 台湾拟购买 1,000 架 AeroVironment 和 Anduril 攻击型无人机
item.description: 据熟悉该交易的业内人士称，台湾国防部已与美国政府签署正式协议，允许其从美国航空航天公司（AeroVironment Inc.【原文：The Taiwan Ministry of Defense has signed formal agreements with the US government allowing it to buy as many as 1,000 attack drones from AeroVironment Inc. and Anduril Industries Inc. to aid in blunting a potential Chinese assault on the island democracy, according to people in industry familiar with the transaction.】

item.title: 收益放缓，印度小型股面临持续下跌风险
item.description: 由于盈利疲软和经济前景黯淡，印度小型公司的股价正在下滑。【原文：The tide is turning against India’s smaller companies as weak earnings and a souring economic outlook spur a downturn in their shares.】

item.title: 聚焦美国大选，亚洲股市必将上涨：市场综述
item.description: 大多数亚洲股市将追随华尔街走高，因为交易商们正在为美国大选和关键经济数据做准备，这些数据将为美联储的下一步决策奠定基础。由于交易商对政治前景进行评估，日本股市可能会继续走低。【原文：Most Asian shares were set to follow Wall Street higher as traders prepare for the US election and key economic data that will set the stage for the next Federal Reserve decision. Japan stocks may tread water as traders assess the political outlook.】

item.title: 受挫的日元仍是美国大选的终极避风港
item.description: 尽管今年日元走势疲软，但历史表明，日本货币仍有望成为投资者避开美国总统大选的意外避风港。【原文：For all the weakness in the yen this year, history shows that Japan’s currency is still in the running to be a surprise haven for investors seeking shelter from the US presidential election.】

item.title: 红杉将从加密货币收购中获利超过 1 亿美元
item.description:
当 Stripe 以 11 亿美元收购 Bridge 时，包括红杉、Ribbit 和 Index  在内的风险投资公司取得了巨大成功。【原文：

Venture capital firms including Sequoia, Ribbit and Index notched big wins when Stripe bought Bridge for $1.1 billion. 

】

item.title: 卡马拉-哈里斯的签名出现在《堡垒之夜》中，候选人在追逐玩家选票
item.description: 从本周一开始，热门视频游戏《堡垒之夜》的粉丝们可以进入一个新的虚拟世界--由民主党总统候选人卡马拉-哈里斯的竞选团队创建的美国自由镇。【原文：Fans of the popular video game Fortnite can enter a new virtual world as of Monday, Freedom Town, USA, created by Democratic presidential candidate Kamala Harris’ campaign.】

item.title: 商业地产崩盘连最安全的债券也受到冲击
item.description:
自大金融危机以来，评级最高的商业抵押贷款支持证券的买家首次蒙受损失。【原文：

For the first time since the great financial crisis, buyers of top-rated commercial mortgage-backed securities are suffering losses.

】

item.title: 拜登敲定限制美国对中国芯片和人工智能技术的投资
item.description: 拜登政府最终确定了对美国个人和公司投资中国先进技术的限制，包括半导体、量子计算和人工智能。【原文：The Biden administration finalized restrictions on investments by US individuals and companies into advanced technology in China, including semiconductors, quantum computing and artificial intelligence.】

item.title: 特朗普前能源部长从公用事业贸易集团卸任
item.description: 美国一家大型公用事业贸易集团的负责人在任职不到一年后即将卸任。【原文：The head of a major US utility trade group is stepping down after less than a year.】

item.title: 高盛认为隔夜拆借利率将因创纪录的国债潮而再次飙升
item.description: 高盛集团（Goldman Sachs Group Inc.【原文：Goldman Sachs Group Inc. said US money markets this week are heading toward what’s becoming an increasingly common month-end ritual: a sharp — if brief — jump in overnight lending rates as Wall Street banks absorb a huge pile of new Treasuries.】

item.title: 布鲁克菲尔德财富公司进军日本再保险市场，聘用主管
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，布鲁克菲尔德财富解决方案公司（Brookfield Wealth Solutions）已进军日本的再保险业务，并聘请曾在巴克莱银行（Barclays Plc）任职的横冈智秀（Tomohide Yokooka）担任董事总经理兼国家主管。【原文：Brookfield Wealth Solutions, has entered the reinsurance business in Japan and has hired Tomohide Yokooka, formerly of Barclays Plc, as managing director and country head, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 思杰母公司旨在修正市场创纪录的第二笔贷款
item.description: 思杰系统公司的母公司正在寻求 2024 年的第二次杠杆贷款重新定价，这是今年此类活动创纪录的一部分，因为市场交易额首次突破了 1 万亿美元。【原文：Citrix Systems Inc.’s parent is seeking its second leveraged-loan repricing of 2024, part of a record year of such activity as the market has topped $1 trillion of deals for the first time.】

item.title: 马克莱姆称加拿大央行必须 "发现 "中性利率
item.description: 加拿大央行行长蒂夫-马克莱姆（Tiff Macklem）对加拿大央行上周大幅降息的决定提出了更多见解，他说，考虑到加拿大央行近年来为抑制物价压力而大幅提高借贷成本，这种宽松政策是合理的。【原文：Governor Tiff Macklem offered more insight into the Bank of Canada’s decision to deliver a jumbo interest-rate cut last week, saying the easing makes sense given how aggressively it hiked borrowing costs to rein in price pressures in recent years.】

item.title: 美元流动性骤降 72%，尼日利亚奈拉跌至历史新低
item.description: 由于外汇市场美元流动性急剧下降，尼日利亚本币创下约两周来最大跌幅，达到历史新低。【原文：Nigeria’s local currency fell the most in about two weeks to a record low, after of a steep drop in dollar liquidity in the foreign exchange market.】

item.title: 法官承认对黄卡车司机 65 亿美元退休金纠纷的裁决有误
item.description: 一名法官周一表示，法院的一项裁决可能会使破产的卡车公司 Yellow Corp. 的股东失去任何追偿权，该裁决存在错误，可能需要推翻一项不利于该公司的关键裁决。【原文：A court ruling that likely wiped out any recovery for shareholders of the bankrupt trucker Yellow Corp. contained an error that may require a key decision against the company to be reversed, a judge said on Monday.】

item.title: 美国生物燃料政策停滞不前，嘉吉、邦吉放缓大豆收购步伐
item.description: 由于美国生物燃料政策的不确定性，包括嘉吉公司（Cargill Inc.【原文：Agriculture giants including Cargill Inc. and Bunge Global SA are slowing their buying of soybeans due to uncertainty over US biofuels policy.】

item.title: 美国财政部将本季度借款预期降至 5460 亿美元
item.description: 美国财政部削减了对本季度联邦借贷的预期，同时继续预计在年底，即联邦债务上限重新生效之前，将有 7000 亿美元的现金余额。【原文：The US Treasury trimmed its estimate for federal borrowing for the current quarter, while continuing to expect a $700 billion cash balance at the end of the year, just before the federal debt ceiling kicks back in.】

item.title: 国际清算银行讨论终止普京希望削弱美元的项目
item.description: 国际清算银行（Bank for International Settlements）正在讨论是否关闭一个跨境支付试点平台，因为俄罗斯总统弗拉基米尔-普京（Vladimir Putin）认为该平台的基础技术是规避制裁的工具，有可能削弱美元在全球金融体系中的主导地位。【原文：The Bank for International Settlements is debating whether to shut down a pilot cross-border payments platform after Russia‘s President Vladimir Putin identified the underlying technology as a tool to circumvent sanctions and potentially undermine the dollar’s dominance in the global financial system.】

item.title: 拍卖引发供应焦虑，国债收益率继续攀升
item.description: 美国政府债券收益率上升，原因是两场国债拍卖需求疲软，表明投资者在下一个融资季度前夕对供应感到焦虑。【原文：US government bond yields rose as weak demand for a pair of Treasury note auctions suggested investors are anxious about supply on the eve of the next financing quarter.】

item.title: 伊朗风险消退，石油大额看涨期权赌注化为乌有
item.description: 那些以创纪录的速度押注油价看涨期权的交易商们正被残酷的现实惊醒：这些合约现在大多一文不值。【原文：Traders who piled into bullish options bets on oil prices at record pace are waking up to a harsh reality: Most of those contracts are now worthless.】

item.title: EA 旗下 BioWare 期待新《龙腾世纪》游戏带来救赎
item.description:
这家曾经声名显赫的制片厂在经历了两部大失败之后需要一鸣惊人

。【原文：

The once prestigious studio needs a hit after two big flops

】

item.title: 通过高收益债券交易，私人飞机热潮涌入小额贷款市场
item.description: 百万航空（Million Air）是一家为超级富豪和高级管理人员提供服务的豪华航空公司，该公司正在向华尔街借款 1.205 亿美元，以扩大其在奥斯汀的业务，满足对停放私人飞机的机库空间的压抑需求。【原文：Million Air, a luxury aviation company catering to the ultra-rich and high-flying executives, is borrowing $120.5 million from Wall Street to expand its operations in Austin to meet pent-up demand for hangar space to park private jets.】

item.title: OpenAI 首席财务官称 75% 的收入来自付费消费者
item.description: OpenAI 首席财务官萨拉-弗里尔（Sarah Friar）说，OpenAI 的绝大部分收入来自为其产品付费的消费者。【原文：OpenAI generates the vast majority of its revenue from consumers who pay for its products, Chief Financial Officer Sarah Friar said, even as the artificial intelligence startup competes in a crowded market to sign up more corporate customers.】
